name: Novotel Amsterdam Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a good choice if you are on a budget. Its a quick bus trip from the airport (although be warned that the blue Accor Bus stops and the IBIS and IBIS Budget before it gets to Badhoevedorp so it can get a little bit packed!!)
reviews.title: Better this time.....

reviews.text: I've reviewed it once before when I had a huge exec suite with a bath in the middle of the room. This time I went for a basic room in the hopes of getting a normal bathroom - which I did. It was OK - a small balcony and a view of Schiphol in the distance. They've also added a Nespresso machine. The furnishing is basic (a bit aged - the headboard has turned yellow!) and the TV is ancient. But they are OK for one night. However the bathroom was grim - small and very dark despite 3 eco-bulbs. The shower was disgusting and had mould all around it so I used the shower over the bath which was at least very clean.
reviews.title: very basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best bit about this hotel is the pub in the basement which is now open from 7pm during the week. This has a large screen showing sports and it serves a great selection of beers and wines. We had Pizza and a large plate of bitterballen (guilty pleasure!!) both of which were incredibly hot and really tasty (EUR 10 per dish) - it was a great surprise and we had a really enjoyable evening there. The barman was great - very friendly and he spoke perfect English for us (thank you!) There isn't much around the hotel so if you want to relax I really recommend the bar in the basement - I'd go back for the bitterballen alone!
reviews.title: good quality per cost

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Missed connection at Schipol and KLM put us in here. It had the look and feel of a contracted room rate, check in process extremly efficient, hand over voucher & sign, dinner was a simple cafeteria food, - nothing wrong with it - but the room was passed it best, still had a small CRT TV and the bath was not as clean as it should be. on plus side it had a good free shuttle bus service both ways to airport,
reviews.title: Good out of town base.

reviews.text: We have been in this hotel on February 2012.I booked a no smoking room but when I went in suddenly I noticed it smelled like smoke, so I went down to the reception and asked for a new room, the receptionist apologized with me and said it was a no smoking room but some customers (not too polity ) decided to smoke even it was forbidden,than gave me a new room on the same floor and that worked good.The room was not too spacious and not too modern anyway it was nice and clean, with everything you need:safe box, iron and iron table for clothes, internet connection,TV, two armchairs,bed was comfy,the bathroom was nice and clean.One day we used the spa area with a pool, sauna and Turkish bath(steam bath) we enjoyed it,at it's same floor the is a pub as well. For two nights we called the room service and one night we have had dinner at the restaurant,good experiences.Breakfast was rich enough.The hotel is far from downtown but close to the airport,it is about 20 minutes far from the airport but well connected to it by a free bus shuttle (to/from the airport,at the reception you can find the time schedule).When at the airport just buy the train ticket to Amsterdam city,the run takes about 30 minutes.Good hotel service/price.
reviews.title: Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our flight from Kuala Lumpur arrived into Schiphol early morning. The free shuttle to the Novotel Amsterdam Airport Hotel was quick and efficient. We were able to check into our suite by 9am, at a substantial 50 euro extra cost! We were not happy with this as there was no additional work undertaken by the hotel, and being set up as a Airport hotel they should allow for arrivals at all times of the day and night particularly when booked well in advance as we had!
reviews.title: It was adequate but ..........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite was worn and dated but clean. Bedlinen was crisp and the bed very comfortable. Pillows of differing hardness were available. Lighting in the bathroom was extremely poor and the towels were small and very thin. There was however a large spa bath in addition to the shower.
reviews.title: watch out for the early check in fee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 1 Sunday night before flight. The Novotel is located a few miles from Schiphol near the village of Badhoevedorp. It was easy to find by car. The rate was 230 euros per night (expensive but this was a late booking as I needed to stay near the village)
reviews.title: Very average hotel - saved by its helpful and cheerful staff

reviews.text: There are about a dozen steps up to the hotel entrance and as it was raining very hard when I arrived I didn't see an alternative entry/exit for wheelchair users - you may want to check with the hotel if this is a need for you? I'm sure they cater for all guests but I felt the entrance was very unwelcoming for those with any sort of physical disability
reviews.title: Amsterdam ,city never sleeps

reviews.text: Check in staff was welcoming and very friendly - they spoke english too which is great as I don't speak Dutch. Was given a room on the 6th (top) floor. There are 2 lifts just off the lobby area. Also off the lobby area was a colourful gift shop, a seating area which one group was using for a meeting, a set of shelves displaying stuff for sale - small beers/wines/soft drinks and snacks etc so that you could stock your room mini-bar if you wanted to.
reviews.title: It Fills a Need With a 90's Vibe

reviews.text: The Novotel at AMS airport is about a 15-20 minute bus ride from the main Schipol terminal. To get your transport, you follow the signs for busses after arrivals and exit the terminal and turn to your right. Bus stops A9 to A13 are where the hotel and rental car busses pull in. The ACCOR HOTELS bus is a large bus (not a minibus) and comes roughly every 20 minutes depending on the time of day. It is free to use. There is a timetable although it is not at all obvious from the hotel web-site what this is. I had to e-mail and ask for the schedule! The bus serves the IBIS and IBIS BUDGET hotels first. If staying at IBIS or NOVOTEL you can use this free bus to get to and from the terminal where you can get regular trains downtown to AMS centraal station.
reviews.title: Functional but dated and certainly not awe inspiring!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is fairly standard if you know what to expect from the Novotel brand. Free wifi, reasonably sized rooms, writing desk, tea/coffee, fridge, safe, etc. The rooms are a bit dated and will very soon be in need of a refurb… e.g. I haven’t been in a hotel that hasn’t moved over to flat screen TVs for a long time. In summary though, the rooms are perfectly functional, staff very amenable and helpful, etc.
reviews.title: Stay only if you must be close to airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel bar and restaurant are a bit expensive price wise. There are two independent restaurants just over the road from the place – although these are not that cheap either. A 10-15 minute walk you find a small town centre for this airport community. There are a few small supermarkets, a couple of fast food joints, a couple of bars and a restaurant. This is where plenty of local busses come in.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like many airport hotels, this place suffers from the tourist bus-group syndrome. Unfortunately, a busload of about 40 camera drunk Orientals (Japanese or Chinese??) had arrived about 5 minutes before I did. This meant that the reception area was in utter chaos with bags, chatter and amusing picture taking of inanimate objects such as fire extinguishers and parking ticket machine was going on all around but I eventually got checked in after about 20 minutes!
reviews.title: Quick response

reviews.text: Getting a short taxi ride to where I was working the next day proved a bit of a hassle. Booked a taxi nice and early but when came to get it, no sign of it. The company was hopeless and later informed the hotel they had picked up the wrong person – erm, I don’t think so as we were waiting well before the allotted time. Got some transport in the end but 45 minutes after we ordered the taxi and had to negotiate with a separate company ourselves to get it and were late for the meeting!
reviews.title: airport hotel, nothing bad to say, nice touches

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as we were flying out the next day. Very friendly at check-in, clean large rooms, restaurant had a wide selection for breakfast and the shuttle to the airport was prompt. Wifi in room was useful and computer in lobby was available to print out boarding passes.
reviews.title: Close to airport

reviews.text: It is always a pleasure to stay at this hotel. I often stay here alone and with a heavy suitcase I am very happy to have the luggage elevator at the entrance. Travel to the airport is convenient, either with car or the shuttlebus, and you are not in the middle of traffic. The rooms are quiet, food is good, staff is helpful and friendly. If I had one complaint it would be that the covers on the bed are almost uncomfortably hot, but that is a personal issue.
reviews.title: Dependable comfort

reviews.text: Prices have gone up but you can still get a good deal here.
reviews.title: Tennis next door

reviews.text: This Novotel is a bit remote, not at the airport, but next door you find excellent indoor tennis and squash courts, and a large fitness/health centre. These facilities are NOT part of the hotel, but really next door and have a reasonable price level. So, if you want to get/stay fit on your Amsterdam stop-over, this is the place to be.
reviews.title: Hidden Charges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms and facilities of this hotel are standard Novotel, noting it looks like it could have some refurnishing.
reviews.title: Watch for hidden charges

reviews.text: The staff is well trained and very help full, the restaurant menu average up to good, the breakfast really well done, with lots of organic choices.
reviews.title: Not good

reviews.text: I stayed here for a night and that was enough.There was a conference on in Amsterdam and rates were very high just about everywhere in the City. I decided to stay close to the airport and get a taxi from there in the morning. The cab fare was 18euro if you decide not to bus it.
reviews.title: So-so

reviews.text: If we start with the positive the room was clean and had a well fitted bathroom.
reviews.title: Good when you have to catch a plane early

reviews.text: However the welcome was poor. On arrival I stood at the desk for what was longer than it should have been before the person on reception right in front of me acknowledged that I even existed - never mind a welcome ! The taciturn approach continued during check-in although the young chap checking in some-one else next to me seemed much more cheerful. Check-out was better in the morning and the two young ladies were pleasant and helpful
reviews.title: Good for the money providing you dont eat off the menu!

reviews.text: In addition whilst my room was clean, there was a musty odour within and - when I went to open the window I saw the sign advising not to do so because of "insects". My room was opposite a rather stagnant looking stretch of water which explains the "insect" warning .
reviews.title: A very good transit hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So overall I would look elsewhere for an Airport Hotel
reviews.title: Very Good Airport Hotel
Goed verblijf
reviews.text: We were booked on a 'park and fly' package in th Mercure Hotel but due to an over-booking there we were re-booked into their sister hotel.
On arrival we could leave our car in the car park adjacent to the hotel.
reviews.title: Mixed Reviews

reviews.text: Check in was quick and very friendly.
reviews.title: Is this a 4 star hotel?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very pleasant; clean, comfortable and spacious. We heard no aircraft noise or any other noise for that matter.
reviews.title: Convenient for airport and has regular shuttle service

reviews.text: You are as with most airport hotels, a bit out of the way in case you want to do something in the evening. We had a drink in the bar downstairs which was ok.
reviews.title: Not quite 4 star.. but still good!

description: The Novotel Amsterdam Airport is a 4 star hotel ideally located in a quiet area around Schiphol Amsterdam Airport, which is only 5 km away. In our hotel, not far from the centre of Amsterdam, a good night sleep is guaranteed. The Novotel is an ideal base for guests on a business trip. All hotel rooms feature free WiFi and airconditioning. The hotel offers 10 meeting rooms, a lobby bar, pub, restaurant, swimming pool, sauna and hamam. Adjacent to a sports centre.
